description:
APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED LOFT CONVERSION AND ERECTION OF A REAR DORMER WINDOW ROOF EXTENSION AND 3 FRONT ROOFLIGHTS IN THE FRONT 
ROOF SLOPE
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:
Drawing no: 0001 (Site Location Plan And Block Plan) Dated February 2024  
Drawing no: 2120 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan, Proposed First Floor Plan, Proposed Loft Floor Plan, Proposed Front Elevation Plan, Proposed Rear Elevation Plan, Proposed Side Elevation 01 Plan And Proposed Side Elevation 02 Plan and Proposed Roof Plan) Dated February 2025  
Drawing no: 0040 (Existing Front Elevations And Rear Elevations Site Photographs) Dated January 2024     
Condition : 2 - The operations would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.
Condition : 3 - The operations would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.
Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay.
